text: El Salvador competed at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea from 12 to 28 July. ==Open water swimming== El Salvador qualified one female open water swimmer. {|class=wikitable style="font-size:90%;" |- !Athlete !Event !Time !Rank |-align=center |align=left|Fatima Flores |align=left|Women's 10 km |2:12:00.6 |57 |} ==Swimming== El Salvador entered three swimmers. ;Men {|class=wikitable style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |-align=center |align=left|Marcelo Acosta |align=left|400 m freestyle |3:55.06 |31 |colspan=2 |colspan=2|Did not advance |-align=center |align=left rowspan=2|Nixon Hernández |align=left|50 m freestyle |24.12 |74 |colspan=4|Did not advance |-align=center |align=left|100 m freestyle |52.74 |84 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ;Women {|class=wikitable style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font- size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |-align=center |align=left rowspan=2|Celina Márquez |align=left|100 m backstroke |1:02.94 |38 |colspan=4|Did not advance |-align=center |align=left|100 m butterfly |1:03.93 |42 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ==References== World Aquatics Championships 2019 Category:Nations at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships
title: El Salvador at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships
